critique: The document is a set of rules and regulations for the civil service. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of order and fairness. There is also an element of wanting to inspire confidence in the system. The language is formal and bureaucratic, which suggests a desire for seriousness and respect. There is a desire to prevent misapprehension in the public mind. The document also aims to prevent arbitrary actions and ensure that appointments are based on merit. The President wants to convey a sense of control and efficiency. The document also aims to address potential issues such as defalcation and embezzlement. The President wants to convey a sense of fairness and equal opportunity. The document also aims to ensure that the civil service is representative of the different parts of the Union. The President wants to convey a sense of accountability and transparency.
